intro: Ormosia nobilis var. bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian ormosia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Ormosia nobilis var. bolivarensis is valued for its ornamental potential and has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal uses.
